document_data.name: Bainligor
document_data.mainbody:
'''Bainligor''' were a race of small, flightless, [[bat]]-like [[humanoid]]s that inhabited the southern reaches of the [[Upperdark]],
{{Cite dragon/227/The Dragon's Bestiary: Monsters of the Underdark|21}} particularly the areas beneath the [[Chultan Peninsula]].
document_data.Description: Bainligors possessed huge pointed ears, ridged snouts, and elaborately sculpted facial features that all together gave them a resemblance to bats. The average height of a bainligor ranged from {{SIrange|3|6|ft}}.
document_data.Combat: Besides their ultrasonic bursts, bainligor fought with their claws and needle-like teeth. They typically attacked in large groups, hoping their combined efforts would quickly pull down any prey.

Society.Diet: The bainligors were omnivorous scavengers. They subsisted almost entirely upon a diet of edible [[fungi]], [[roth√©]], [[spider]]s, various insects, and even rotting flesh if necessary. The eating of noxious foods in particular was a source of boasting for bainligor.
Society.Languages: The bainligor were capable of communicating in [[Undercommon]], though their high-pitched voices made it difficult for other races to properly hear them, even if they lowered their voice to be heard.
Society.Relationships: Due to the language barrier imposed by their physiology, bainligors rarely spoke with other races and engaged little in trade.

document_data.Rumors & Legends: Bainligor legends speak of a group of dozens of bainligors called the "Deep Tribes", composed entirely of Revered Ones, who were said to have purposely starved themselves into that state. The Deep Tribes were said to hunt in great groups in the deeper reaches of the Underdark, not for nourishment but to simply revel in their strength and the fear they instilled in other beings. The Deep Tribes were believed to be likely nothing more than a legend, as there had never been any confirmed sightings by the sages and savants of other Underdark races.
